alert.note: Alert for Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 25 at 6:11PM CST until further notice by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following county, Sevier. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated due to heavy rain combined with snow melt across the mountains. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 711 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sevierville, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Pittman Center, Elkmont, Harrisburg, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Wears Valley and Roundtop Mountain State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
